cyclone.name: FIONA
cyclone.current_location: about 335 mi (535 km) ESE of the Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: moving west toward the Leeward Islands, then expected to slow and turn west-northwest, passing near the Virgin Islands and crossing or skimming eastern Puerto Rico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern Puerto Rico (near/just east of San Juan)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Puerto Rico (including Vieques and Culebra) and the U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible late Saturday into Sunday, with higher gusts likely near and east of the track.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Localized coastal flooding possible Saturday–Sunday; surge heights generally below 3 ft along north and east coasts.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches with isolated 10 inches; potential flash and urban flooding and mudslides in higher terrain.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents affecting north and east-facing beaches.
